item.title: Test
item.description: This is a test blog. More updates coming to this section soon.

item.title: About Me
item.description: Hi! I’m Yogesh Sapkota, EE graduate from Youngstown State University. I am interested in electronics & hardware design, programming embedded systems and machine learning. I am a huge Formula 1 and FC Barcelona fan. Reach out to me at ysapkota@student.ysu.edu or connect with me on LinkedIn.

item.title: Blog Posts
item.description: COMMON EE Interview Questions This is a test to practice common hardware interview questions with questions taken from Monty Choy’s The Ultimate List of Hardware Engineering Internship Interview Questions.

item.title: Contact
item.description: Reach out to me at ysapkota@student.ysu.edu. My LinkedIn account

item.title: EE Questions
item.description: This is a test to practice common hardware interview questions with questions taken from Monty Choy’s The Ultimate List of Hardware Engineering Internship Interview Questions. These questions are applicable for fresh grad EE interviews as well.

item.title: Projects
item.description: Some of the projects that I’ve worked on so far: EMBEDDED SYSTEMS TM4C123 LaunchPad Evaluation Kit Programmed Tiva C series launchpad in C to implement ADC, PWM to control servo motor, traffic light simulator & stepper motor control using Finite State Machines, communication protocols like SPI to interface a display, and stepper-motor driven joystick controlled toy car, interface with temperature and humidity sensor DHT11, Ultrasonic distance sensor HC-SR04 MSP430 Development Board Programmed TI’s MSP430G2553 microcontroller in C to learn about microcontrollers and used functionalilites like interrupts, UART, ADC, PWM etc.
